column4: when i get to the jaunty login screen, i get a kernel panic.  i can go to alt-f1 beforehand and see a load of output ending in "end trace", but i can't find it anywhere in the logs.  where should i be looking?
i can't see the entirety of the output because it's gone off the screen and the machine freezes immediately after outputting
kernel panic is not always logged, depending on the problem I think
thanks.  gah.  what the hell am i supposed to do now :/
do you only get the panic if you start X?
i can single user fine.  the kernel panic happens up to 2 minutes after the x login screen appears
does it hang the machine completely?

pasting this from earlier: i have a hp compaq dx2200, installed jaunty, it was fine until i installed restricted graphics drivers, but now it kernel panics with flashing keyboard lights within 2 minutes of the login screen.  the actual time appears to be random.
yes
out of interest, have you tried booting to normal login screen then going ctrl-alt-F1 and doing "sudo invoke-rc.d gdm stop"
by the way, it was still panicking after i replaced the card - i had to install jaunty afresh.  then when i installed the restricted drivers it happened again
i'll try that now

would be interesting to see if it crashes then, because a difference between that and single user mode is that although both have no X, you'll still get all the other background services running which you don't in single mode
perhaps you could also change your video mode in grub to get more text on the console :)
isn't it enabled by default?
I forget :)
i did try sysrq but got nothing
i can't see any modem ports on the back
worth seeing if it's enabled first
IIRC cat /proc/sys/kernel/sysrq
found this http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/slackware-14/how-to-diagnose-kernel-panic-cause-538024/ :o
ah, looks like i can't get the logs to work after all then...
i've tried noacpi, and disabling some things in the bios, neither helped
